body: We expect tensor ops to be sufficient wherever FP16 inputs are numerically feasible. The environment variable just provides a sanity check to quickly rule out tensor ops as a culprit when issues are encountered (e.g., during some conversion from fp32 to fp16). In this context, a global option is sufficient. Once the numerics of fp16 training are well understood, the opt-out can likely be removed entirely.
